transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: (Fade in
transcript.dialogue: Dave Thomas is on the monitor)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Alright, I'll do it. Do I get a gun?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, but use your own piece. I can't be connected in, uh, any way.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (clears his throat, alerting Zorak to SG's arrival)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, Dave, uh, that, uh...

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Um...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: ... fair was, uh... fun.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You weren't in any fair!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I heard you tellin' Dave to shoot me in the brain with a laser, out behind the dumpster.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Ah...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Aw, c'mon, that doesn't sound like me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That makes me sad.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I never said that!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, you did.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We're buds!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I heard it.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I never said that, and I would never say that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Dave heard it, didn't you, Dave?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (nods slowly)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Oh, now I remember! I did tell him that, didn't I?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Are you gonna do anything about it, or are you just gonna hold a grudge here...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm not gonna hold a grudge. I, I'm just gonna go to my room and never do the show again.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: There you go.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And, I won't speak to any of you ever again!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That'll work.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And since there's no food in my room, I'll probably just die there.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Okay... (exhales)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How would that be... ya fat babies?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Good!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, good.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (chuckles)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (takes off from his desk, flies off the set)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Okay, this is my show, now that Space Ghost is gone, this is the Dave Thomas Show.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah!!

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost won't be able to be back for the rest of the day.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Awright!

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: I've often wondered from watching your show...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: [So we forgot all about our good friend Space Ghost...]

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (to Zorak) ... how tall are you?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, about seven feet.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Seven feet tall.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I'm pretty big.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: I'm impressed.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I know.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still thinking to himself) (mocking) ["How tall are you? I'm pretty tall."] (walks out of shadows)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: How much can you bench press?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, about 320.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: I could tell that from your over-developed quads.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (stammering) Hey Dave, Dave, ask me how tall... how I can press.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (walks in front of Zorak's keyboard pod) Did it just get noisier in here? (he stops in front of his desk) It stopped. (quietly, to Zorak) Hear how quiet it got? (sits down at his desk) Uh, so, how's the, uh, how's the show going?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's going pretty good!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: As if I care.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's funny.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, too bad you're missing it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (looks at a cue card) What are y'all talking about?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (to himself) We're not talking about anything, now that you're here.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Actually, we were talking about...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I heard it. Say, Dave...

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Yeah?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you ask Zorak about his hollow arms, and how you can break one off and sip a drink through it?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Oh god!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: If you'd ever want to put your lips on it.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, I thought you were leaving.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But I don't think you'd want to put your lips on something like that. Would he, Zorak? Answer him. Answer me.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: This ain't your show. It's the Dave Thomas Show.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm not here for your show. Your show's stupid and I hate it. And I never liked it.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I never liked it, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I just came down to get my keys so I could.. drive over to where my new friends are.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We don't care.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where it's fun.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, go get 'em. What are you waitin' for?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't know... I thought I'd say hello to Dave.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (looks back silently)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey Dave.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Alright, you did that, now get your keys.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pounds his desk) Say Dave, tell me about your new projects.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey! That's enough!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah man, leave.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I am leavin'.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: So leave. I mean, you've been leavin' for five minutes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And I'm never comin' back.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Good! Go! Bye!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: When I go, that's it.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So [bleep] go!

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (looks shocked)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares in silence)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Dave doesn't want you on his show! Isn't that right, Dave?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (pauses) No no, no no no...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Now man, you said it was your show...

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Aw, c'mon.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fine, I'm leaving! (pounds his fist)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Alright, go ahead.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alright, I will go ahead!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Then move it!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, get outta here!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pauses) Hey hey, let's show some of my old clips.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pounds his desk) Fine, ya bunch of fat babies! Don't expect me back here any time forever! (pounds desk again)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: What a shame.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs hysterically)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs hysterically)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Narrator
transcript.dialogue: Outside the Hall of Justice...

transcript.speaker: Narrator
transcript.dialogue: ... is this Hole...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (rides by on a garden tractor) Hey Snakefish! My man! (Snakefish stands up, along with someone in a turban, who ducks down again. Space Ghost's tractor goes off screen and stops)

transcript.speaker: Narrator
transcript.dialogue: ... of Justice.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Gimme five, my man. I know you didn't ask me to, but I went ahead and mowed your lawn anyway.

transcript.speaker: Snakefish
transcript.dialogue: Gee, thanks, uh... Space...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Snakefish
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, that's what I said. Here's ten dollars.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Here, let me get you some change in my inviso... (invisos out "by accident") Hey! Look at that! I turned invisible! (invisos back in) I don't want to tell you your job or anything, but I bet superpowers like that would come in pretty handy for you guys around the Hole of Justice. (as Space Ghost talks, five other characters appear in the hole and behind the car and trash cans)

transcript.speaker: Snakefish
transcript.dialogue: We can all do this. (all of them inviso out)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, that makes us friends then, huh? Hello... hello... hello... (characters sneak away under inviso power) Where are you?!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Hey hoser, you take off!

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Hey, take off, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey wait, you guys, you guys...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Take off, eh? (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Dave, Dave, tell me to take off.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (stares back in silence)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh c'mon, somebody tell me to take off, eh? (chuckles)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (silence)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: C'mon, do it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to set) Hey, take off, everyone! Take it all off!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (groans)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Aw, man!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I thought you had some friends!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I do.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Then where are they?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh... they were all out visiting other friends, uh, that I know through them. Dave, do you mind if I just sit here until my friends tell me where they are?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I do mind. It bothers me when people do that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: By "people", do you mean me?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (standing by Space Ghost's desk) Dave, is there a problem here?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: No, no problem at all.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Because if there's a problem... (slaps cards down on Space Ghost's desk) I have the solution.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: No problem.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Alright, you just call me if you need anything, Dave.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (walking away) The Dave Thomas Show. Heh heh, I love it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He's not the host of the show.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah he is.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No he isn't, and you shut up, because I'm about to conduct an interview.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Alright, Space Ghost, how thick is your neck?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'll ask the questions, Dave. How thick is my neck? It's 48 inches.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: That's a decent sized neck.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Radius, Dave.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: 48 inch radius.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Radius.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: How do you measure it, with a straightened coat hanger or...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I just cut my head off and count the rings on my esophagus.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Fair enough.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's that on your jaw, Dave? Oh-h-h, it's fat.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Thank you for even acknowledging that I have a jaw, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in low voice) Not much of one.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Hey.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: I'm a guest. How about a little civility, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, you're the guest. Then who's the host?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Of the Space Ghost show?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, Dave. The Space Ghost show.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Uh... Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (in background) Tell it on the mountain!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: I.. Help me out here! Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (aims his power band at Dave) Screw you all to hell! (brings his finger near the button)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still aiming, ready to blast, with teeth clenched)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: How's it goin', Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Awesome, Dave.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still aiming) I'm serious!

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Give it your best shot, big boy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (blasts Dave with his power bands, but the blasts are deflected)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (chuckles) Think you need to take that in to the shop.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (chuckles)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Y'all in there? (Snakefish peers over the edge of the hole, in inviso mode) I know you're in there.

transcript.speaker: Snakefish
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) No, I, I was just testing it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where is everyone?

transcript.speaker: Snakefish
transcript.dialogue: They're... they're out saving stuff.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I hope they save their appetites! Because I just ordered us a large pizza! Y'all like pizza, don't ya?

transcript.speaker: Snakefish
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. (the others peer over the hole's edit, in inviso mode) They won't be back for, like, a year. They're way out on Mars. (points up)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's funny, I came by Mars on my way over, and it doesn't have any life! (moves toward Snakefish, the others duck down)

transcript.speaker: Snakefish
transcript.dialogue: Oh, gee, look, look, you really... you gotta go.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I know you're invisible in there! Ya fat babies!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay, you ready?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Alright! Start the music! (music starts, then he swings by on a rope) Whoa! (he lets go of the rope, and crashes off screen; smoke and flames erupt)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, comments?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'd say that... probably killed him.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I'm not dead, I'm not dead, check it out. I can do that better, though.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Oh, I'm sorry to interrupt. (walks in front of Zorak's keyboard pod, toward desk) I'm just Space Ghost, the guy the show's named after.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Welcome mat is out for you, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nobody talk to me or look at me.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Alright, we won't. (drinks from his coffee cup)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You want to get out of the shot? (camera zooms in on Dave)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stepping between the camera and monitor, out of focus) Am I in the way here? Gosh, I hope not. (camera pans off of Space Ghost, he moves in front of it again)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: You're kind of a one-trick pony, aren't you, Space Ghost (laughing)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (continues trying to stay in front of the camera, as Moltar moves it) I didn't realize it was my show.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Take your time, Space Ghost, I got all day. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I don't, Dave. (camera zooms back) Because I am a busy man. (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Dave... where'd you get that blazer?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Well...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (walks across stage with his arms full of rolls of toilet paper) (voice muffled) I'm back.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Sorry to hear that. Anything I could help you with?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. You can help me with this toilet paper. (drops all the rolls, intentionally) Because I'm going back to your Earth and roll the entire godforsaken planet. Starting with Snakefish and his stupid Hole of Justice. Because I'm better than them, aren't I.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Well...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm a super-hero, AND a super-artist.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: I sense sometimes a little insecurity, maybe a little kind of self-identify problem.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) So.. you think I have a problem.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Not specifically, but it's always good to keep an open mind about it...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, I'll open his mind.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, with what? I hammer? You were gonna say that, I know.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's not what I was gonna say!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well then, with what? What was it gonna be? What sort of carpenter's tool were you gonna use on my skull?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What are you talkin' about?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I know you said it!

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Have you ever...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He said it, Dave.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Have you ever seen a... not a shrink, maybe just a counselor...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All the time, in Jerusalem. Wait, what?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Oh, never mind.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, no, come on, I'm listening.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Somebody who might be able to sit in a nice zero-gravity environment with you, and the two of you could kind of lob questions back and forth...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Like me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, like Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: No, not like Zorak. Somebody who reads.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar has an education. A doctorate, it says so on his degree, right Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Show me your hiney!

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: No, not like Moltar. Somebody who has an education...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Show me the hiney!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, he does have an education.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I wanna see it.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Making a suggestion here. You hire someone, for a hundred and five bucks an hour...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How about you?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: What about me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (does his power band move thing) You do it, I command it.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (leans back) Alright. Let's give it a whirl.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (backward speech: "He doesn't know what he's doing.")

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: How do you feel about yourself, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I would have to say that I'm the bomb. A Number 1.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Okay. What's wrong with being number 2?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (silence)

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Did I ask you a ridiculously hard question?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You did?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Let's go back to number 1 then.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, and let's start calling me number 1.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: And as number 1...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A Number 1. The bomb.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: You ever feel like you'd like to have someone to talk to?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (offscreen) SHOW ME THE HINEY!!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Put your pants on!

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: I mean, other than Zorak and Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) You mean like, um, like girls?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (smiles and nods) Yeah, girls.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't need no woman, banging on the bathroom door, saying she has to go to the bathroom, when I'm in the bathroom. It's my bathroom!

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: I think you've been out here a little too long.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, go out to the dumpster, where it's beautiful.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's beautiful, man. You will so love it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No. It's cold. At the dumpster.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: It's gonna get a lot colder, too, if you keep staying out here by yourself. C'mon! Live a little.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I like to dance.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: No kiddin'! Well, that's a start.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I mean... REALLY like to dance.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Hm mm. Well, that's what a lot of teenage girls do when they're growing up, but you're number 1. You gotta get beyond that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, let's start calling me number 1, how about that?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Listen, I didn't come here to make you feel bad, I have tremendous respect for you, Space Ghost. But, under the category heading of self-improvement, there's always room, even at the top, to make yourself a little better.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, thanks Dave. I never thought about it that way. Never thought about anything except for... [I never thought about anything.]

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, Moltar, (nods in their direction) take care of this guy. He's lonely.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, Moltar, hop in the cruiser. We're gonna roll Earth.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No way, man.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, Dave and I are goin' out for a drink.

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: Oh, am I?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, me too, I'm goin' too. Right?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, don't you remember? I was talkin' about us goin' out? Uh, takin' Moltar maybe?

transcript.speaker: Dave Thomas
transcript.dialogue: (nods) I do.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (taps his cards) Uh, okay if I come?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No, uh, we're all sick. (fake cough) See ya! (runs off stage)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's a free country.

transcript.speaker: Snakefish
transcript.dialogue: Then feel free to bite my ass, huh?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, bring your snake ass over here and say that!

transcript.speaker: Snakefish
transcript.dialogue: I just did, and you didn't do anything!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'll do whatever I want, it's a free country.

transcript.speaker: Snakefish
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's so funny? (The villain jumps Space Ghost) Aaah!

transcript.speaker: Snakefish
transcript.dialogue: Yeah!
